Description of incident: An employee of Grand Teton Storage removed documents from The Children's Center's storage facility after they failed to pay storage bills.  A concerned citizen found seven boxes of the old medical records and other personal information next to a dumpster.  The information was seven to eight years old and included names, Social Security numbers, addresses, dates of birth, and payroll information.  A Grand Teton Storage employee acknowledged that a mistake had been made and the employee who improperly disposed of the records will face disciplinary action.  Idaho Department of Health and Welfare eventually recovered and secured the records.
